body:
### Problem

I want to install NvChad, however the neovim version provided by the package manager (Debian) is too small. Therefore I tried to build neovim myself, but without success. I have followed the instructions on https://github.com/neovim/neovim/wiki/Building-Neovim.

```sh
FAILED: usr/lib/luarocks/rocks-5.1/mpack 
cd /home/bandura/Downloads/neovim/.deps && /usr/bin/cmake -E env  /home/bandura/Downloads/neovim/.deps/usr/bin/luarocks build mpack 1.0.10-0 CC=/usr/bin/cc LD=/usr/bin/cc
Warning: Failed searching manifest: Failed extracting manifest file: failed extracting /home/bandura/.cache/luarocks/https___luarocks.org/manifest-5.1.zip
Warning: Failed searching manifest: Failed loading manifest for https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rocks-moonscript-org/moonrocks-mirror/master/: /home/bandura/.cache/luarocks/https___raw.githubusercontent.com_rocks-moonscript-org_moonrocks-mirror_master/manifest-5.1: No such file or directory
Warning: Failed searching manifest: Failed loading manifest for https://luafr.org/luarocks/: /home/bandura/.cache/luarocks/https___luafr.org_luarocks/manifest-5.1: No such file or directory

Error: Could not find a result named mpack 1.0.10-0: No results matching query were found for Lua 5.1.
To check if it is available for other Lua versions, use --check-lua-versions.
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
```

### Steps to reproduce

[Full log](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/12909453/session.txt)


### Expected behavior

neovim is successfully built.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

None, since not yet built

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

I was just trying to build neovim.

### Operating system/version

Debian-based

### Terminal name/version

mate-terminal

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

Not at all yet, I have tried to build neovim

comment_data.body: If you want to just use the latest stable Neovim, just download the appimage from the release page.
I would rather install neovim as deb. Hence the attempt to build it myself.
Looks like a luarocks download failure. Is the problem consistent? (Sometimes it is flaky.)
I have tried it several times with and without Privoxy. However, without success.

yeah, a proxy will lead to problems.

But something is off -- Neovim 0.9.4 should build with mpack 1.0.11, not 1.0.10.

That is a local issue then. Please uninstall all system luarocks and wipe the caches (always `make distclean`).

> Warning: Failed searching manifest: Failed loading manifest for https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rocks-moonscript-org/moonrocks-mirror/master/: /home/bandura/.cache/luarocks/https___raw.githubusercontent.com_rocks-moonscript-org_moonrocks-mirror_master/manifest-5.1: No such file or directory


Also make sure you haven't configured any mirrors yourself.

Please don't just blindly paste full logs for everything you tried; that just clutters up things.

> Also make sure you haven't configured any mirrors yourself.

How exactly do you do that or how do you remove them?
I have no idea; it's your system. All I can say is that your connection to luarocks is somehow broken, and that prevents you from building Neovim. It's not an issue for other people.

```
$curl -v https://luarocks.org/manifest-5.1.zip
*   Trying 45.33.61.132:443...
* Connected to luarocks.org (45.33.61.132) port 443 (#0)

* using HTTP/1.1

< 
Warning: Binary output can mess up your terminal. Use "--output -" to tell 
Warning: curl to output it to your terminal anyway, or consider "--output 
Warning: <FILE>" to save to a file.
* Failure writing output to destination
* Failed reading the chunked-encoded stream
* Closing connection 0
* TLSv1.2 (OUT), TLS alert, close notify (256):
```
Manually, however, I can download the manifest file without any problems.
Is there any way I can manually download the problematic files using wget or curl?
You can try replacing the files in the `.deps` folder (the errors tell you the location).

The problem was that the make script tries to create and read files outside the git repo. This is forbidden by default for me.
When disabling the directive it works: `firejail --noprofile make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo`.

Maybe the make script can be modified so that it doesn't just access any files in my home directory, but stays in its own directory?
We've already removed `luarocks` from the build, so this should not be an issue anyway.

title: Failed to build neovim
